definition: to burst out/to appear unexpectedly/to break (media story)
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Ned burst into a fit of giggles while he was on the phone.
sentences.chinese: 奈德講電話時突然爆出一陣喀喀的笑聲。

sentences.english: This is the biggest post-Cold War US-Russian spy scandal broke.
sentences.chinese: 這是冷戰結束後爆出的最大俄美間諜醜聞。

sentences.english: Here's an example from last week out of natural-gas producer Chesapeake Energy (CHK, news, msgs).
sentences.chinese: 上星期從切薩皮克能源公司又爆出這樣一個例子。

sentences.english: Why dosen't Sun Yat-sen University blow out such a scandal?
sentences.chinese: 爲何就不見中山大學爆出這樣的醜聞？

sentences.english: But chatting chatting, broke a lot of classic quotations.
sentences.chinese: 但聊着聊着，爆出了不少經典語錄。

sentences.english: Aishan has no choice but to reveal that Youli is in love with Ah Bing and not her.
sentences.chinese: 愛善情急之下爆出有禮愛的是阿冰，衆人愕然。

sentences.english: The wet wood was spitting out sparks.
So many judges of the same court taking bribes had shocked the whole country.
sentences.chinese: 同一個法院，爆出這麼多法官涉嫌受賄，震驚全國。

sentences.english: Iran has been maintaining a tough stance since the outbreak of the nuclear issue.
sentences.chinese: 自核問題爆出以來，伊朗一直堅持核強硬政策。

sentences.english: My dear teacher, your love can make the dead tree burst the new bud, make the desert become the oasis.
sentences.chinese: 老師，您的愛能使枯木爆出新芽，使沙漠變成綠洲。

sentences.english: There was almost an upset in the finals of the men's floor exercise.
sentences.chinese: 男子自由體操決賽幾乎爆出冷門。

sentences.english: The media dredged up a scandal.
There were many unexpected results during the World Shortcourse Swimming Championships in Sweden .
sentences.chinese: 在瑞典舉行的世界短池游泳錦標賽中爆出了許多冷門。

sentences.english: As Mr Berlusconi arrived at the palace, a large crowd booed and jeered.
sentences.chinese: 當貝盧斯科尼到達總統府時，人羣爆出噓聲和嘲笑聲。

sentences.english: This question is splashed across magazine covers every time there's a fresh high-profile cheating scandal.
sentences.chinese: 每當有新鮮的負心醜聞爆出，雜誌上就滿是此類問題。

definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
(of video clips, rumors etc) to circulate on the Internet
